page.title: 16Industry.
page.content: Sywell is predominately a farming area but very few people are actually employed in agriculture. There is a Garden Centre and just one shop. There is a small area of light industry next to the airport although many firms have closed down recently resulting in loss of jobs. The remaining industries at present include: air display organisers, L.P.G. gas and camping equipment suppliers, distributors of electronic components, agricultural machinery engineers, haulage, storage and distribution, storage of office equipment, furniture etc., manufacturers of rubber-based vehicle suspensions, flying instructors, air shipping and forwarding agents, and an eletronic equipment distribution centre. Attached to the airport is an agricultural and aerodrome maintenance group and a motel with 49 bedrooms.
